summary: This is a reply memorandum filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys in support of her renewed motion for bail. It argues the government's case relies almost exclusively on three witnesses' testimony without significant documentary corroboration, details a substantial bail package including her spouse's assets, and contends the government has not met its burden to show she is a flight risk.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, seeking release on bail. Her defense argues the government's case against her is weak and relies on uncorroborated witness testimony.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the primary figure in the abuse allegations; the defense argues the government's case against Maxwell is a substitute for prosecuting Epstein.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signatory on the reply memorandum.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Cohen & Gresser LLP.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from her own law office.

persons.name: William Julie
persons.context: French extradition expert who provided a report stating it is highly unlikely France would refuse to extradite Maxwell.

persons.name: David Perry
persons.context: U.K. extradition expert who provided an opinion that Maxwell would be highly unlikely to successfully resist extradition from the United Kingdom.

persons.name: B. Houtz
persons.context: Issued a memo regarding potential discontinuation of legal calls and visits at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as having been arrested in France and reportedly under investigation for alleged sexual assaults by Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: The government alleges Maxwell facilitated Epstein's sexual abuse of minors. The defense argues the government's case against Maxwell is a substitute for prosecuting Epstein.
Cohen is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys representing her in the bail motion.
Maxwell's spouse has come forward as a co-signor on her bond, pledging assets and describing a committed relationship of over four years.
Brunel is reportedly under investigation in France for alleged sexual assaults by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Arrest of Jean-Luc Brunel in France
events.description: Modeling agent Jean-Luc Brunel was detained in France and is reportedly under investigation for alleged sexual assaults by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: COVID-19 Surge at MDC
events.description: There is a surge of COVID-19 cases at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), with 113 positive cases reported, increasing health risks for inmates including Maxwell.

events.title: Initial Bail Hearing
events.description: A prior bail hearing where the government made representations about the strength of its evidence, which the defense now claims were inaccurate.

keyFacts: The defense argues the government's case against Ghislaine Maxwell relies almost exclusively on the testimony of three witnesses concerning events over 25 years ago, with little to no contemporaneous documentary corroboration specifically against Maxwell.

Maxwell's spouse and several friends/family members have come forward to support a substantial bail package, pledging assets and offering sureties, which the defense argues demonstrates strong ties to the United States.
Maxwell has offered to waive extradition rights from France and the United Kingdom, and her experts opine it is highly unlikely either country would refuse extradition if she fled.
The defense contends Maxwell's previous actions to maintain privacy (using a trust, pseudonym) were for protection from harassment, not indicative of flight risk.
A COVID-19 surge at the MDC with 113 cases and potential suspension of legal calls/visits is cited as further justification for bail to protect Maxwell's health and right to counsel.
